content.raw: I didn't quite follow your comment.  This section of the PR updates the tutorial. The use of the `set_performer` service is optional, so the examples should still work.
content.html: I didn't quite follow your comment. This section of the PR updates the tutorial. The use of the set_performer service is optional, so the examples should still work.

pull_request.title: [Blueprint] Service to add performers at runtime

update.description:
I needed a mechanism to add performers during a simulation run (after load). Spawned models are likely to be performers.

Requires #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/107

## Testing

1. `ign-gazebo -f levels_no_performers.sdf -v 4 --levels`
2. `ign service -s /world/levels/level/add_performer --reqtype ignition.msgs.Performer --reptype ignition.msgs.Boolean --timeout 2000 --req 'name: "vehicle_blue", geometry:{type:0,box:{size:{x:2, y:2, z:2}}}'`
3. ign topic -t "/model/vehicle_blue/cmd_vel" -m ignition.msgs.Twist -p "linear: {x: 4.0}"
update.title: [Blueprint] Service to add performers at runtime

pull_request.title: [Blueprint] Service to add performers at runtime

pullrequest.title: [Blueprint] Service to add performers at runtime

content.raw: I don't think this is thread safe. `OnAddPerformer` is called from a separate thread and I would advise not to call anything on `EntityComponentManager` from this thread. My recommendation would be to store the the `_req` in a queue and process it in `UpdateLevelState`. I realize this means we won't be able to return anything meaningful, but I don't think we can help it right now.
content.html: I don't think this is thread safe. OnAddPerformer is called from a separate thread and I would advise not to call anything on EntityComponentManager from this thread. My recommendation would be to store the the _req in a queue and process it in UpdateLevelState. I realize this means we won't be able to return anything meaningful, but I don't think we can help it right now.

content.raw: A small suggestion would be to call the service `set_performer` instead, because `add` may suggest that the service itself is spawning a new performer.
content.html: A small suggestion would be to call the service set_performer instead, because add may suggest that the service itself is spawning a new performer.

pullrequest.title: [Blueprint] Service to add performers at runtime

content.raw: Wouldn't it be better if this was it's own test? I see the performer `perf_box` is commented out in `levels.sdf`, but this now means the test is not exercising if `LevelManager::ReadPerformers()` can read in multiple performers.
content.html: Wouldn't it be better if this was it's own test? I see the performer perf_box is commented out in levels.sdf, but this now means the test is not exercising if LevelManager::ReadPerformers() can read in multiple performers.

pull_request.title: [Blueprint] Service to add performers at runtime

pullrequest.title: [Blueprint] Service to add performers at runtime

content.raw: This will affect distributed simulation, which currently assumes that all performers are known at startup. This assumption is changing soon with the updates I'm making to be able to transplant performers though, so I think we can keep spawned performers out of distributed sim until then.
content.html: This will affect distributed simulation, which currently assumes that all performers are known at startup. This assumption is changing soon with the updates I'm making to be able to transplant performers though, so I think we can keep spawned performers out of distributed sim until then.

content.raw: It's not safe to modify the ECM in the transport callback thread, this should be done during the update loop
content.html: It's not safe to modify the ECM in the transport callback thread, this should be done during the update loop

content.raw: "Dynamic performers" may be associated with movement. How about something like "performers on demand" or "spawned performers"?
content.html: "Dynamic performers" may be associated with movement. How about something like "performers on demand" or "spawned performers"?
